u.a: Everybody is in the room, Bartosz hides away in the other room.
dr Weist peekaboos Bartosz from behind the door .
Bartosz runs around the room . then he seats himself on a rocking horse .
what are you doing on the horse ?
mother is pointing to the toy-horse's ear .
mother points to the ear again .
mother points to the horse's eye .
and here what does the horse have here ?
mother points to the horse's mouth .
and what does the horse have here ?
Bartosz tries to dismount the horse .
what are you going to do ?
what are you going to do ?
he should have said "chcę zejść", "I want to dismount".
what are you going to do ?
mother puts Bartosz on the floor . he hides away behind the door .
you want to get down right ?
should have used reflexive form "chowam się".
Bartuś what is it like outside ?
Bartosz gets out from behind the door and looks at the window .
see what it is like there .
mother lifts Bartosz up and brings him to the switch .
switch the light off and on .
and what have you done now ?
mother points to the lamp . the light is on .
the light is switched off again .
Bartosz switches on the light . he imitates the noise of the switch .
I do not know what this (bonaki) is .
mother points to the green tape-recorder's bag .
well I will show you something .
Bartosz points to the tape-recorder in a green bag .
what the lady has is green .
Bartosz holds out his hand towards the green bag .
the Polish utterance should be "ten sam kolor".
show me what you have got .
Bartosz gives the flashlight to Jolanta .
Bartosz looks at the green bag .
Bartosz finds the flashlight and plays with it switching it on and off .
mother gives Bartosz a piece of chocolate .
Bartosz reaches out for another piece of chocolate .
mother gives Bartosz a piece of chocolate .
Bartosz pays attention to the tape-recorder .
what do you want little son ?
mother gives Bartosz another piece of chocolate .
mother raises up the chocolate-bar and hides it in her hand so Bartosz cańt see it .
Bartosz looks around . He ca`nt see the chocolate .
mother gives Bartosz a book . Bartosz looks through it . mother points to the picture of a dog .
show me a book little son .
mother insists pointing to the same picture .
Bartosz turns from the book and looks at the tape-recorder .
mother draws Bartosźs attention to the book .
Bartosz takes the book and brings it do dr Weist . the picture depicts a bear .
we will find a book and you will go and read out for the women .
you will read for the women .
a piece of chocolate flew away .
mother shows him the picture of a swing .
Bartosz impatiently turns over the pages .
in the meantime father entered the next-door bathroom . the sound of running water can be heard .
mother wants him to comment on the picture in the book .
Bartosz is still looking at the bathroom door .
Bartosz runs towards the bathroom door .
"myj-myj" is an uninflected child-invented form . here Bartosz adds the personal ending (3_S) e .
and what else is daddy doing ?
"myj-myj" is uninflected form, here it is reflexivized .
and what is daddy doing with the soap ?
Bartosz wants to enter the bathroom . mother opens the bathroom door . father is shaving himself .
little son what is daddy doing ?
mother points to Jolanta who is writing .
mother shows him a picture depicting an animal .
and what is the boy doing here ?
Bartosz points to the yellow flower in the picture .
Bartosz turns his head towards the tape-recorder .
and what is it here son ?
mother wants to draw Bartosźs attention to the book .
Bartosz comes back to his toys . he climbs the rocking horse .
Bartosz sits on the horse and wants his mother to swing him .
sit on it and rock it ?
sit on it and rock it .
where is your mommy to sit ?
father switches off the light in the bathroom . Bartosz looks this way .
Bartosz is still on the horse .
the words of the song are memorized .
Bartosz tries to get down from the horse .
I do not want (on) the horse .
the utterance should read either "na koniku" (on the horse) or "konika" (genitive) .
do you want to get down ?
mother takes him down from the horse .
Bartosz shows interest in the tape-recorder in the green bag .
Bartosz still looks at the microphone .
Bartosz stands close to the tape-recorder and looks at it .
mother points to the green bag .
mother gives Bartosz the flashlight . He takes it and turns to Zofia .
come mommy will give you the flashlight .
am I to switch it on ?
Zofia switches the flashlight on and gives it back to Bartosz .
mother shows Bartosz an electric bulb of the flashlight .
and tell us what this is .
mother shows him the bulb again .
father switches off the main light . Bartosz looks at the lamp .
father switches on the flashlight . Bartosz points to it .
mother points to the ceiling and wants Bartosz to look at it .
Bartosz gives his father the lit flashlight .
Bartosz wants to reach the ceiling on which he can see moving shades .
am I to lift you up ?
father puts Bartosz on the floor .
Bartosz shows his mother that the flashlight is switched off but the mother looks the other way .
Bartosz wants to draw his mother`s attention .
Here the nominative has a vocative case's function .
in the meantime the flashlight is switched on .
the main light is switched off .
and what is it like in the room .
what is it like in the room .
the flashlight is taken away from Bartosz . He is looking for it .
father puts on his coat and his cap . he leaves for the other room .
he has got his coat and his cap on .
father shows the cap on his head .
and what does daddy have on his head ?
the mother did not understand Bartosz .
what has daddy got on his head ?
Jolanta wants to draw Bartosźs attention away from the tape-recorder .
Bartosz repeats his statement in a high voice . He points to the tape-recorder .
there is nothing on here, nothing .
it is not on at all .
he has used double reflexivization . he should have said either "nie pali się" or "się nie pali". the latter form is colloquial .
Jolanta tries to make Bartosz change the subject .
Jolanta rolls the ball towards Bartosz .
Bartosz doesńt want to play with the ball .
it is water that is running .
Bartosz looks at Jola who is writing .
Bartosz points to the green bag .
Bartosz takes Zofia`s hand and starts singing a Polish play-song .
at the end of the song everybody should sit on the floor but Bartosz stands firm .
the circle has broken and we all bounce !
Bartosz arrays everybody in a circle and sings .
mother wants Bartosz to stop singing and shows him the ball .
but uncle is tired and mommy is also tired .
Bartosz starts singing again . since mother does not want to play any more he turns to dr Weist .
Bartosz takes dr Weist's hand and walks with him .
Bartosz pushes the chair towards dr Weist .
the sound of a car-engine can be heard . Bartosz runs towards the window .
what did daddy drive in son ?
mother points to the pram again .
Bartosz falls down from the sofa .
Bartosz looks at the picture . it is a clock .
yes this is a bim bam@o (=clock) .
Bartosz turns and hits against the sofa .
mother wants to know which part of his body he has hit . literally translated the question reads "in what did you hit"?
the prefix "po" suggests that Bartosz wants to make the verb perfective . the verb is an onomatopeic word for "to hoover".
PRO|this & NEUT:NOM:S NEG|not V|be_on & IMPF:PRES:3S REFL|self .
Bartosz looks through the picture-book . mother shows him the same picture again .
the picture shows children picking cabbage .
the mother repeats the incorrect form .
children are picking up the cabbage .
I was picking up the cabbage .
as Bartosz turns his head he can see the light reflexes on the microphone .
Bartosz is shown a picture of a sea .
the picture shows children swimming in water .
Bartosz runs away from the room .
mother went out to answer the door . Bartosz can hear that his friend Martunia is speaking with his mother .
Bartosz stands at the door from behind which he can hear the voices .
Bartosz takes Zofia`s hand and leads her to the door and shows that he wants her to open the door .
what do you want to do ?
should I open the door for you ?
do you know who was here ?
Bartosz wants to leave the room and enter the hall where he could hear Marta a while ago .
Bartosz still wants to see if Marta is in the hall .
Bartosz gives up standing by the door . he comes back to the room .
